label: assumption-regularity-summary
title: Summary of Regularity Assumptions
nl_summary: A set of five technical assumptions (H1 through H5) detailing the required regularity (smoothness, boundedness, continuity) of the spatial domains, potential functions, flow fields, physical constants, and algorithmic functions necessary for the rigorous analysis of the coupled mean-field system.

notes.text: These assumptions are prerequisites for proving the existence, uniqueness, and long-term behavior of solutions to the coupled mean-field system.

label: assumption-domain-regularity
title: Regularity of the Valid Domain
nl_summary: The valid position domain $X_{\text{valid}} \subset \mathbb{R}^d$ is assumed to be an open, bounded set with a $C^3$ boundary. Its signed distance function is $C^2$ near the boundary, allowing for the definition of a unit inward normal vector $n_x(x)$.

bullet_items.name: Smoothness
bullet_items.text: $X_{\text{valid}}$ is an open, bounded domain with $C^3$ boundary $\partial X_{\text{valid}}$.

bullet_items.name: Distance Function
bullet_items.text: The signed distance function $d(x) := \text{dist}(x, \partial X_{\text{valid}})$ is $C^2$ in a tubular neighborhood $\mathcal{T}_\delta := \{x \in X_{\text{valid}} : d(x) < \delta\}$ for some $\delta > 0$.

bullet_items.name: Unit Inward Normal
bullet_items.text: The unit inward normal vector is $n_x(x) = -\nabla d(x)$ for $x \in \mathcal{T}_\delta$.

conditions.text: The signed distance function $d(x)$ is $C^2$ in $\mathcal{T}_\delta$.
The unit inward normal $n_x(x) = -\nabla d(x)$ is defined for $x \in \mathcal{T}_\delta$.

parameters.description: The boundary of the valid domain
The signed distance function to the boundary
A tubular neighborhood of the boundary
Positive constant defining the tubular neighborhood size
The unit inward normal vector at $x$

label: assumption-integrator-regularity
title: Regularity of the Discrete Integrator
nl_summary: Assumes a specific mathematical form for the position update produced by the discrete kinetic integrator (BAOAB), defining it in terms of current state, time step, mass, force, and a remainder term $R_{\text{pos}}$.

bullet_items.name: Position Update Formula
bullet_items.text: The discrete kinetic integrator (BAOAB) position update $x^+(\tau; x,v)$ is given by:
bullet_items.latex: x^+(\tau; x,v) = x + v\tau + \frac{\tau^2}{2m}F(x) + R_{\text{pos}}(\tau; x,v)

parameters.description: Force as a function of position.
Next position after the integration step.
Position error/remainder term for the discrete integrator.

notes.text: This specific form implies that the integrator has a known structure, likely related to a specific order of approximation where the leading terms are standard Euler/Verlet steps.

label: assump-density-regularity-killing
title: Density Regularity
nl_summary: The phase-space density $f^\tau(x,v)$ at the start of a discrete timestep must be bounded in $L^\infty$ by $M_f$ and must be continuously differentiable ($C^1$) in space ($\Omega$), with its spatial gradient also bounded in $L^\infty$ by $M_{\nabla f}$.

parameters.description: The phase-space density at the start of a discrete timestep.
Positive constant bounding the $L^\infty$ norm of the density.
Positive constant bounding the $L^\infty$ norm of the gradient of the density.
